---


Standardizing date formatting to MM-YY. Creating a utility function and updating all date displays.


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="task" data-tool-name="todo_write">
<details><summary>Tool use: **todo_write** • Todo List</summary>

- [-] Create a utility function to format dates to MM-YY format
- [ ] Update view-chronicle page to format dateAdded in table to MM-YY
- [ ] Update peakMonth and highActivityMonth formatting to MM-YY in view-chronicle
- [ ] Update my-timeline page placeholder to show MM-YY format

---


Creating a date formatting utility and updating all date displays to use MM-YY:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="write">

<details><summary>Tool use: **write** • Edit file: lib/dateUtils.ts</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 46, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,46 @@
- 
+ /**
+  * Formats a date string or Date object to MM-YY format
+  * @param date - Date string or Date object
+  * @returns Formatted date string in MM-YY format, or empty string if invalid
+  */
+ export function formatDateToMMYY(date: string | Date | null | undefined): string {
+   if (!date) return '';
+   
+   let dateObj: Date;
+   
+   // If it's already a Date object, use it
+   if (date instanceof Date) {
+     dateObj = date;
+   } else {
+     // Try to parse the string as a date
+     dateObj = new Date(date);
+   }
+   
+   // Check if date is valid
+   if (isNaN(dateObj.getTime())) {
+     return '';
+   }
+   
+   // Format as MM-YY
+   const month = String(dateObj.getMonth() + 1).padStart(2, '0');
+   const year = String(dateObj.getFullYear()).slice(-2);
+   
+   return &#96;${month}-${year}&#96;;
+ }
+ 
+ /**
+  * Formats a Date object to MM-YY format (for use with Date objects directly)
+  * @param date - Date object
+  * @returns Formatted date string in MM-YY format
+  */
+ export function formatDateObjectToMMYY(date: Date): string {
+   if (!date || isNaN(date.getTime())) {
+     return '';
+   }
+   
+   const month = String(date.getMonth() + 1).padStart(2, '0');
+   const year = String(date.getFullYear()).slice(-2);
+   
+   return &#96;${month}-${year}&#96;;
+ }
+ 
```

</details>

</tool-use>

Adding a helper function to format monthYear strings for display and updating the event dropdown:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="search_replace">

<details><summary>Tool use: **search_replace** • Edit file: app/view-chronicle/page.tsx</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 29, lines removed: undefined

```diff
@@ -236,4 +236,33 @@
      return timelineEvents.filter((event) =&gt; event.eventType === eventType);
    }, [timelineEvents, eventType]);
+ 
+   // Helper function to format monthYear string to MM-YY format for display
+   const formatMonthYearToMMYY = (monthYear: string): string =&gt; {
+     if (!monthYear || !monthYear.trim()) {
+       return '';
+     }
+     
+     // If already in MM-YY format, return as-is
+     const trimmed = monthYear.trim();
+     const mmYyMatch = trimmed.match(/^(\d{2})-(\d{2})$/);
+     if (mmYyMatch) {
+       return trimmed;
+     }
+     
+     // Try to parse and format
+     const dateString = parseMonthYearToDate(monthYear);
+     if (dateString) {
+       return formatDateToMMYY(dateString);
+     }
+     
+     // If parsing fails, try to parse directly as date
+     const parsedDate = new Date(trimmed);
+     if (!isNaN(parsedDate.getTime())) {
+       return formatDateObjectToMMYY(parsedDate);
+     }
+     
+     // If all else fails, return original
+     return trimmed;
+   };
  
    // Helper function to parse month_year string to date
```

</details>

</tool-use>

```diff
@@ -645,5 +645,5 @@
                  {filteredEvents.map((event) =&gt; (
                    &lt;option key={event.id} value={event.id}&gt;
-                     {event.monthYear ? &#96;${event.monthYear}: &#96; : ''}{event.event}
+                     {event.monthYear ? &#96;${formatMonthYearToMMYY(event.monthYear)}: &#96; : ''}{event.event}
                    &lt;/option&gt;
                  ))}
```

Verifying the changes are complete. Summary of updates:

## Summary

Standardized date formatting to MM-YY across the app.

1. **Created a date utility** (`lib/dateUtils.ts`):
   - `formatDateToMMYY()` - formats date strings or Date objects to MM-YY
   - `formatDateObjectToMMYY()` - formats Date objects to MM-YY

2. **Updated `app/view-chronicle/page.tsx`**:
   - Date Added column in the contacts table now shows MM-YY
   - Peak Month metric now shows MM-YY (was MM/YYYY)
   - High Activity Month metric now shows MM-YY (was MM/YYYY)
   - CSV export formats dates to MM-YY
   - Event dropdown displays monthYear in MM-YY format

3. **Updated `app/my-timeline/page.tsx`**:
   - Placeholder text changed from "09/2025" to "09-25" to match MM-YY format

4. **Updated `app/upload-contacts/page.tsx`**:
   - Date Added column in preview table now shows MM-YY
   - Date Edited column in preview table now shows MM-YY

All date displays now use the MM-YY format (e.g., "01-24" for January 2024). The formatting utility handles various input formats and converts them to MM-YY for display.

Adding a function to format full dates and updating the Date Added column to show the full date:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="search_replace">

<details><summary>Tool use: **search_replace** • Edit file: lib/dateUtils.ts</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 32, lines removed: undefined

```diff
@@ -44,4 +44,36 @@
    return &#96;${month}-${year}&#96;;
  }
+ 
+ /**
+  * Formats a date string or Date object to full date format (MM/DD/YYYY)
+  * @param date - Date string or Date object
+  * @returns Formatted date string in MM/DD/YYYY format, or original string if invalid
+  */
+ export function formatDateToFull(date: string | Date | null | undefined): string {
+   if (!date) return '';
+   
+   let dateObj: Date;
+   
+   // If it's already a Date object, use it
+   if (date instanceof Date) {
+     dateObj = date;
+   } else {
+     // Try to parse the string as a date
+     dateObj = new Date(date);
+   }
+   
+   // Check if date is valid
+   if (isNaN(dateObj.getTime())) {
+     // If invalid, return original string if it's a string, otherwise empty
+     return typeof date === 'string' ? date : '';
+   }
+   
+   // Format as MM/DD/YYYY
+   const month = String(dateObj.getMonth() + 1).padStart(2, '0');
+   const day = String(dateObj.getDate()).padStart(2, '0');
+   const year = String(dateObj.getFullYear());
+   
+   return &#96;${month}/${day}/${year}&#96;;
+ }
  
  
```

</details>

</tool-use>
